(1017)     An Important Interview Regarding 
                        Physicians' Wages 


     (On the morning of Dec. 4, 1913, the leading brethren 
     of the Pacific Union Conference conferred with Mrs. E. 
     G. White at her Elmshaven home in regard to the remuneration 
     of our sanitarium Physicians. A stenographic report 
     of the interview was made and the ribbon copy bears a 
     handwritten note of endorsement by Mrs. White in these 
     words: "This is correctly presented, and I repeat this 
     for the benefit of others. May the Lord help us and teach 
     and guide us at every step in our difficulties." Essential 
     portions of the report of this Interview follow.-- 
     Compilers of Selected Messages II, p. 202.) 


     Present: Ellen G. White, Elders F. M Burg, G. W. Reaser, W. M. Adams, J. H. Behrens, C. L. Taggart, A. G. Christiansen, W. C. White; Also C. C. Crisler.
